summary: TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2006 CHEVROLET TRAILBLAZER. WHILE DRIVING AT NIGHT, THE HEADLIGHTS AND HIGH BEAM LIGHTS FAILED WITHOUT WARNING. THE VEHICLE HAD TO BE TURNED ON AND OFF SEVERAL TIMES IN ORDER FOR THE LIGHTS TO FUNCTION NORMALLY AND, OTHER TIMES, THE LIGHTS WOULD NOT TURN BACK ON. THE CONTACT STATED THAT THE ELECTRICAL SYSTEM IN THE ENTIRE VEHICLE WOULD FAIL WITHOUT WARNING AND CAUSE THE VEHICLE TO STALL. THE CONTACT TOOK THE VEHICLE TO THE DEALER WHERE THE DRIVER'S DOOR SWITCH WAS REPAIRED PER AN UNKNOWN NHTSA CAMPAIGN NUMBER. THE VEHICLE WAS NOT DIAGNOSED NOR REPAIRED FOR THE OTHER FAILURES. THE MANUFACTURER WAS MADE AWARE OF THE FAILURES. THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 192,916.
